intro: Physaria brassicoides, commonly known as bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has small, rounded, inflated pods that resemble bladders, giving it its common name. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Physaria brassicoides is an annual or biennial plant that thrives in arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
